oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Peaceful desegregation in Chattanooga Phi Delta Kappan article, 1964 May
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dalton, Elizabeth L; Carmichael, Benjamin E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Article by Elizabeth L. Dalton, coordinator of secondary education for Chattanooga public schools, and Benjamin Carmichael, Chattanooga school superintendent, published in the Phi Delta Kappan education publication. The article praises the school board and citizens of Chattanooga for the peaceful desegregation of schools.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Phi Delta Kappa international studies in education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education meeting agendas, reports, and correspondence, 1965-1966
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:rightsHolder: Dalton, Elizabeth L; Carmichael, Benjamin E.
